page.title: 13HEALTH AND SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: The {PORTH RESERVOIR}was{built {to }supply Newquay with water. The reservoir was constructed 25-26 years ago covering about 4o acres and is now a major feature of the landscape around Newquay. Only anglers and permit holders are allowed access and Brown and Rainbow trout fishing is available. {ST.MAWGAN CHAPEL}(built 1877)is now used by peace campaigners who are against recent government spending on nuclear weapons. It consists of a wooden floored room with a small front porch. There are benches inside containing cushions embroidered with the Dove of Peace. A prayer of peace can be found on the wall near the altar and the door is always kept unlocked so that people can enter for prayer.Meetings are held every Sunday.
